issue.title: Repository request: mlkem-c-embedded
issue.body:
I'd like to request the following PQCP repository:

**Name**: mlkem-c-embedded
**Description**: This library provides a MLKEM implementation optimized for embedded microcontrollers. The library will have both stack optimizations and speed optimizations for 32-bit platforms. The first goal is to take the state-of-the-art Cortex-M4 implementations (in [pqm4](https://github.com/mupq/pqm4) ) and turn them into portable production-grade MIT-licensed implementations. Where needed (inline-)assembly will be added to achieve best performance while keeping the generic portable implementations as an option. In the long term, the goal is to optimize for more 32-bit platforms. Obvious choices would be 32-bit RISC-V (e.g, [HiFive1](https://www.sifive.com/boards/hifive1-rev-b))  or any of Arm Cortex-M3, Arm Cortex-M7, Arm Cortex-M55, Arm Cortex-M85. It will depend on contributors which platforms will be considered.

**License**: MIT
**Access**: 
 - Admin: @mkannwischer 
 - Maintainer: @mkannwischer 
 - Core contributors: @mkannwischer [@potsrevennil](https://github.com/potsrevennil)

**Existing code**: https://github.com/mupq/pqm4 based on https://github.com/pq-crystals/kyber/tree/standard (However, the license situation in pqm4 is not ideal, so I do expect that we'll have to reimplement certain parts to be able to license everything under MIT.)

**Call for contributors**: We are looking for co-maintainers and contributors to help drive this library forward. If you are interested, please reach out to me!

issue.title: Agree and document contribution guidelines & PR process
issue.body:
We need to clearly articulate the roles/responsibilities of parties involved in the code submission process, and how that process is executed. Ideally having some consistency within pq-code-package would be desirable

This should likely be places on our code documentation site (when agreed) and linked to from CONTRIBUTING.md in each repo

Specifically commit (merge / squash / rebase) should be considered. projects vary in their preference. I've tended to use merge, despite the noise (it seems much of k8s does too?) despite the merge commit noise

Lots of other areas to cover - getting started, code submission guidelines, local build/test, creating a good pr, release notes/docs impacts, templates, ci/cd checks, approval process/assignment .....

issue.title: Repository request: mlkem-rust-libcrux
issue.body:
I'm requesting the following PQCP repository:

**Name**: mlkem-rust-libcrux
**Description**: This library provides a portable ML-KEM implementation with some optimisations for AVX2. Full AVX2 support will be added over the coming months. The code is formally verified for panic freedom, correctness, and secret independence in [F*](https://www.fstar-lang.org/) using the [hax](https://github.com/hacspec/hax) toolchain.

**License**:  Apache-2.0

**Access**:
* Admin: @franziskuskiefer 
* Maintainer: @franziskuskiefer 
* Core contributors: @franziskuskiefer @karthikbhargavan 
 
**Existing code**: https://github.com/cryspen/libcrux/tree/main/src/kem

**Call for contributors**: We are looking for co-maintainers and contributors to help drive this library forward. If you are interested, please reach out to me!

issue.title: Repository request: mlkem-libjade
issue.body:
Repository where we will be placing formally verified asm implementations of mlkem coming from libjade (https://github.com/formosa-crypto/libjade).

Bootstrap Ids:
- cryptojedi, tfaoliveira, mbbarbosa, MQuaresma

to the organization. We can then also add to pq-contributors and pq-embedded as per #21

issue.title: Add Add someone to GitHub
issue.body:
If you want to be able to assign bugs to someone, they only need **Read** access.

Please include:

* GitHub ID to add: MQuaresma
* Project to be added to: libjade

Part of https://github.com/pq-code-package/tsc/issues/24


* [Team to be added to](https://github.com/orgs/pq-code-package/teams): pqcp-contributors, pqcp-libjade

issue.title: ML-KEM Test Vectors
issue.body:
This a request to create a repo for ML-KEM test vectors.
A potential source is https://github.com/C2SP/CCTV/tree/main/ML-KEM pending how the CC0 license check works out.

It is likely that there could multiple sources.

issue.body:
### Current State

Currently a template

issue.title: Arrange next hackathon
issue.body:
I suggest we consider running another hackathon.

We can discuss what went well/not so well, whether it's worth running another one, and define specific objectives.

It may include any of
 - ongoing onboarding 
 - more focus on ci/cd
 - 'pipelines' between repos / reuse
 - consistency 
 -docs
.....

I think it could be useful and can volunteer to setup/arrange if the TSC concurs.
